column4: What is the cause of the endless loop the installer goes into between the 5th and 6th step?
Can someone help me with installing 6.06, please?
Can someone help me with installing 6.06, please?
what's the problem?
The installer goes into an endless loop between the 5th and the 6th step(the step where he wants a partition).
is this a windows box?
He endlessly accesses the cd and the hd
I booted from the 6.06 cd
So, no it's not a windows machine
how is it presently partitioned?
There are 12 partitions (with some partitions as linux type and with ext3 formatted). On the 6th partition I want to install 6.06
Editing the layout of the partitions is not an option because I have fully working installations on the other partitions
What can I do to avoid this endless loop
I assume the partition you want to put it on is over 4Gb, if it isn't then it needs to be, if you do a manual partition it will ask you where to put root, swap etc & it should install correctly
The partiotn is 7GB
you could also use the alternate cd which uses a text installer & should give you more control
If I install from the alternate cd do I get the same installation as from the destop cd?
the end result will be the same
Okay, thanks
the one you are using at the moment uses a gui, the other one a text installer
I assume that you have also done the self-test on that CD to make sure it's OK?
